item.title: PlayStation-Exclusive Games For PS5 And PC Are Still Available For Steep Discounts
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps5-game-deals-playstation-studios-holiday-sale-2024/1100-6527965/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're looking to add to your PS5 game collection or grab a few gifts, the 2024 PlayStation Holiday Sale is still running and includes most PS5 console exclusives for big discounts. While it's true that Black Friday and Cyber Monday featured some deals that are no longer available, such as Marvel's Spider-Man 2 for $30, the majority of PlayStation Studios games that were on sale during the big shopping event are priced the same right now.

A bunch of PS5-console exclusives are up for grabs for only $30, including God of War: Ragnarok, Gran Turismo 7, Ghost of Tsushima Director's Cut, Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart, and more. A few exclusives are even available for just $20, such as Hideo Kojima's Death Stranding: Director's Cut and a pair of games that actually come with two games each: The Nioh Collection and Uncharted: Legacy of Thieves Collection. The former offers extremely good value for two of the best souls-likes around, while the latter compiles the two most recent action-adventure games in Naughty Dog's heralded Indiana Jones-like series.

Several of PlayStation's 2024 console exclusives are discounted, too. Helldivers 2, the most popular PlayStation Studios release of the year, is only $25 for Amazon Prime members. The smile-inducing 3D platformer Astro Bot only has a modest $10 discount, but it hadn't received any discounts before the start of the holiday sale. Team Ninja's latest action-RPG Rise of the Ronin is up for grabs for $30 off, and the flashy character-action game Stellar Blade is $20 off.

PlayStation Direct has a few deals on collector's editions that are worth checking out, too. For instance, Horizon Forbidden West's Collector's Edition is 50% off, dropping the price to only $90. Marvel's Spider-Man 2's Collector's Edition, which includes a very cool statue of Venom fighting both Spider-Men, is discounted to $150, down from $230. Sackboy: A Big Adventure's Special Edition has fallen from $90 to $50. This edition includes a cute Sackboy plush in a tiger suit and an art book.

Check out the full list of PS5 holiday game deals below. Keep in mind that Amazon is sold out of most of the games on this list. Best Buy has most of the deals in stock, but it's hit-or-miss at Walmart and Target. Below the PS5 game deals, you'll find shorter lists of PlayStation Studios PC game deals at Amazon and PS4 game deals.

If you need to pick up a PS5, the best offers available now are the Fortnite Cobalt Star Edition consoles and the PS5 Slim Digital bundled with NBA 2K25 for $375 at Best Buy. The NBA 2K25 bundle is sold out at Amazon, Walmart, and Target, so snag one before it's gone.

PS5 Slim Holiday Console Deals:

  • PS5 Slim: Fortnite Cobalt Star Edition -- $424 ($500)
  • PS5 Slim Digital: Fortnite Cobalt Star Edition -- $374 ($450)

PlayStation Studios PC Game Deals - PlayStation Holiday Sale 2024

You'll need a Prime membership to snag all of the deals listed below with the exception of Ratchet & Clank. That said, there's another reason to sign up for Prime beyond getting Sackboy: A Big Adventure, God of War, and other great PlayStation Studios PC ports. Prime members can claim and keep 72 free games from the Prime Gaming hub right now.

  • Ghost of Tsushima: Director's Cut (Steam) -- $48 ($60)

item.title: Fanatical's Winter Sale Is Absolutely Stacked With Awesome PC Game Deals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fanaticals-winter-sale-is-absolutely-stacked-with-awesome-pc-game-deals/1100-6528395/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fanatical's Winter Sale event is here, bringing huge discounts to hundreds of PC games, and offering special deals that can get you free bonus Steam keys, coupoon codes, and more.

The sale runs from Wednesday, December 11 until Saturday, January 4, 2025, and each day there will feature a new, limited-time Star Deal. The first deal is a whopping 79% off Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot Legendary Edition, dropping it to just $25.19 instead of its normal $120 price. This version includes the base game a collection of DLC content that includes new story content and stat-boosting items. This price will only be available until December 12, after which a new Star Deal will take its place.

As for the deals that will be available throughout the sale, some highlights include Ace Combat 7: Skies Unkowm for $5.39 (was $60), System Shock remake for $14 (was $30), and V Rising for $18.19 (was $35). You can even grab the recently released Indiana Jones and the Great Circle for $58.79, which is a decent discount from its normal $70 price tag.

You'll also find big price cuts to numerous publishers' catalogs like Bethesda, Sega, Bandai Namco, and more. Capcom games are getting some particular good price cuts, including some of its latest releases like Dragon's Dogma 2 for $33.59 (was $70), Street Fighter 6 for for $25.79 (was $70), and the Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection for $41.49 (was $50).

As for smaller releases and indies, there are some great deals on titles like Spirit of the North for $1.54, Breathedge for $5.87 (was $35), or Indika for $13 (was $25). Check the list below for even more of our favorite deals in the Winter Sale, or browse the full lineup at Fanatical.

As an added bonus, all orders of $15 include either a free game or coupon code. You can select between an extra $1 coupon or Steam key for Blazing Beaks, Garfield Kart: Furious Racing, Alchemy Garden, White Noise Online, or a random mystery game. All orders also include a 5% off coupon code usable on a future Fanatical purchase. Games purchased at Fanatical are delivered as official keys for their respective launchers--most are Steam keys, but some are redeemed on other platforms like the Epic Game Store. Instructions for redeeming your keys are included in your order confirmation.

Along with the Winter Sale deals, Fanatical also has a special Holiday Bundle deal that lets you build your own bundle from a list of 25 games for as little as $0.50 per key. Some highlights include the fantasy FPS roguelike Ziggurat, alien evolution simulator Thrive, and Wario Ware-inspired microgame collection Pureya. The retailer launched several other new bundle deals during its recent Bundlefestive 2024 event, including the latest edition of its awesome Platinum and Prestige Collections, and a new Play on the Go Bundle that Steam Deck players will want to check out.

Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.

item.title: PlayStation Action Figures And Plushies Hit New Low Prices - Kratos Plush Has Textured Beard
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-action-figures-the-last-of-us-horizon-forbidden-west-god-of-war-amazon-deals/1100-6528397/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fans of PlayStation's Horizon series can get the recently released Aloy action figure on sale for only $35 (was $50) at Amazon. This is the best deal yet for the first--and priciest--figure in PlayStation's new line of collectibles by Spin Master. The PlayStation Shapes Collection has grown to include six characters across four PlayStation Studios franchises. Amazon also has limited-time deals on Atreus from God of War: Ragnarok and the combo pack featuring Joel and Ellie from The Last of Us.

You could put the $15 you're saving on the Aloy action figure toward the official 10-inch plush, which was also designed by Spin Master and is available at Amazon for $20. Unfortunately, the Kratos action figure isn't discounted to pair with Atreus. Fortunately, the newly released 10-inch Kratos plush is on sale for a limited time, dropping the price from $20 down to $16.49. The Kratos plush has a majestic, textured beard.

  • PlayStation Studios 6-inch Action Figures
  • Aloy from Horizon Forbidden West (Deluxe 6" Figure) -- $35 ($50)
  • Joel & Ellie from The Last of Us (6" Figure 2-Pack)-- $45 ($50)
  • Varl from Horizon Forbidden West (6" Figure) -- $26.72 ($30)
  • Atreus from God of War: Ragnarok (6" Figure) -- $21 ($30)
  • Kratos from God of War: Ragnarok (6" Figure) -- $30
  • Jin Sakai Action Figure - Ghost of Tsushima (6" Figure) -- $30
  • PlayStation Studios 10-inch Collector's Plushies
  • Kratos from God of War Ragnarok (10" Plush) -- $16.49 ($20)
  • Aloy from Horizon Forbidden West (10" Plush) -- $20

Horizon Forbidden West - Aloy 6-Inch Deluxe Action Figure

$35 (was $50)

Aloy is the only "Deluxe" figure in the lineup so far. All of the other PlayStation figures have an impressive 30-plus points of articulation, but Aloy has 42. Along with having increased adjustability to strike different poses, the Deluxe figure comes with a lot more accessories than the other solo figures. Aloy has 15 different accessories, including her trusty bow and spear weapons, six swappable faces, and eight hands. The additional hands are necessary to swap weapons.

The Last of Us - Joel & Ellie 6-Inch Action Figures (2-Pack)

$45 (was $50)

Amazon's deal on The Last of Us figure pack is certainly not as good, but this is the first time it has received a discount. Plus, to be fair, this released on November 1, whereas the Aloy figure launched back on August 1. It's a bit surprising The Last of Us figure pack is even discounted at all.

Joel and Elie each have over 30 points of articulation, and the set comes with a total of 15 accessories. Joel has three different weapons--shotgun, revolver, and machete--and five extra hand pieces. Ellie has four extra hand pieces that allow you to switch between her bow and arrow, pistol, rifle, and switchblade. Both figures come with removable tactical backpacks.

God of War: Ragnarok - Kratos 10-Inch Plush & Atreus Action Figure

Kratos - $16.49 (was $20) | Atreus - $21 (was $30)

Amazon just recently started carrying the official Kratos and Aloy plushies. Plush Kratos looks awesome. PlayStation says this is a "collector grade" plush, with embroidered details such as accurate depictions of his tattoos, scars, and outfit from the game. But obviously the most notable aspect of this plush is the full, textured beard and bushy eyebrows.

Meanwhile, the action figure version of Atreus is on sale for $21 (was $30). Boy has 33 points of articulation and five accessories, including his bow and arrow.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Path Of Exile 2: Best Mercenary Build Guide
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/path-of-exile-2-best-mercenary-build-guide/1100-6528387/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Mercenary is one of the new classes in Path of Exile 2 but it's already become a fan-favorite. Mercenaries are another ranged class, but they have the ability to hit much harder than the standard Ranger. With the right gear, skills, and gameplay loop, enemies and bosses become trivial to the Mercenary.

However, to get to that point, you need a proper build guide for the Mercenary in Path of Exile 2. Fortunately, we have a complete build guide below, including the best skills, Support and Spirit Gems, and Ascendancy to use for the Mercenary.

Mercenary Overview in Path of Exile 2

As we said before, the Mercenary is a ranged class in Path of Exile 2 but utilizes a different skillset compared to the Ranger. Instead of a bow and arrow, you use a crossbow in the primary slot, which is what most of your top skills will be based around.

Mercenaries use the crossbow to wield a plentiful amount of ammunition types. You can switch to each of these ammo types the same way you cast different skills on another class, such as the Sorceress. While this switching back and forth to different ammo might feel clunky at first, you'll understand what ammo to use for certain situations as you continue leveling with the Mercenary.

With your crossbow, you can primarily deal two kinds of elemental damage, fire and frost. Other skills allow for regular crossbow bolts and armor-piercing rounds, though, so you're not limited to just elemental damage. Luckily, the Mercenary doesn't have to rely on a single elemental damage type for any build, so you're free to use any skill that deals the most damage.

Your main attribute as a Mercenary will be Dexterity, as this improves the accuracy of your shots. However, since the Mercenary is a well-rounded class, some of your gear could require extra points in Intelligence or Strength. For the most part, though, your skills are based around Dexterity and Strength, so that's where you'll want to put a majority of your attribute points.

Best Mercenary Skills in Path of Exile 2

Now that you have a basic understanding of the Mercenary, it's time to equip the class with its best skills. The Mercenary doesn't necessarily rely on super late-game skills, as the early skills you can unlock deal a ton of damage right out of the gate.

The best skills for the Mercenary are a mixture of different elemental damage plus other types of rounds that can be fired quickly or have more ammo before needing to be reloaded. Most of your elemental ammo must be reloaded after a single shot. While these skills tend to deal more damage, reloading during the middle of a fight isn't prudent at all times. As such, having access to skills that can be shot quicker or for longer are always good to have in your back pocket.

Here are the skills we recommend for the Mercenary in Path of Exile 2:

  • Armor Piercing Rounds
  • Permafrost Bolts
  • Flash Grenade
  • Explosive Shot
  • Gas Grenade, then Oil Grenade, then Cluster Grenade
  • Ripwire Ballista
  • Galvanic Shards

In addition to all these skills, you can also slot in the basic "Crossbow Shot," which comes from equipping any type of crossbow. This is the most basic attack possible, but it's nice to have for weaker enemies and consistent damage against bosses.

Cluster Grenade is the one skill on the list that you'll have to wait to use, as you likely won't unlock it until you reach Cruel difficulty. You'll also see we initially have Gas and Oil Grenade slotted in for Cluster Grenade, as they are unlocked a smidge earlier. The rest of the skills are at Level 12 or below, so they can be used mid-way through the campaign. You have a wide range of ammo types available with these skills, including multiple kinds of elemental damage and rounds with more shots and higher fire rates.

Best Mercenary Support and Spirit Gems

After equipping some of the skills above, you can move on to slotting in the recommended Support Gems for those skills. Also, you don't want to forget about Spirit Gems, as the Mercenary has access to some great persistent buffs.

Here are some Support Gems we recommend for a few skills, as well as the best Spirit Gems to use:

Support Gems

  • Second Wind (Flash Grenade)
  • Glaciation (Permafrost Bolts)
  • Persistence (Oil/Cluster Grenade)
  • Magnified Effect
  • Lockdown (Ripwire Ballista)
  • Ingenuity (Flash Grenade)
  • Wildfire (Explosive Shot)
  • Lightning Infusion (Galvanic Shards)
  • Double Barrel (Armor Piercing Rounds)

Spirit Gems

  • Shard Scavenger
  • Attrition

Best Mercenary Passive Skills

Moving on, you'll want to follow several key paths on the Mercenary's Passive Ability skill tree. For the most part, sticking with increases to projectile damage, reload speed, AoE effects, and attribute buffs for Strength and Dexterity is the best route. However, if you want a more defensive-minded Mercenary, boosting armor and evasion rating are also viable options.

Here are some Passive Abilities we suggest for the Mercenary:

  • Remorseless
  • Instant Reload
  • Reusable Ammunition
  • Volatile Catalyst
  • Cluster Bombs
  • Adrenaline Rush
  • Repeating Explosives

Best Mercenary Ascendancy in Path of Exile 2

Finally, after leveling the Mercenary, you can select an Ascendancy for it. There are two options available for the Mercenary in early access: Witch Hunter and Gemling Legionnaire.

Witch Hunter is where you want to go in most cases, as it has the best damage-boosting abilities and it's much simpler overall. The Ascendancy also has great explosion properties, allowing you to make your explosions longer, deal more damage, and even interrupt enemies during casting.

That does it for our Mercenary build in Path of Exile 2. If you're looking to run another class, we recommend the Monk, which has a spectacular and balanced build.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
